title: Unhandled internal compiler error, assert name != empty(String[32])
body:
### Version Information

* vyper Version (output of `vyper --version`): 0.3.1
* OS: linux
* Python Version (output of `python --version`): 3.8.10

### What's your issue about?
I tried to make a comparison between an argument of type String[32] with the return of the empty(String[32] function), an internal compiler error occurs when I make this comparison.

Code example that causes the error:
```vyper
@external
# @version ^0.3.1

def __init__():
    pass

@external
def is_empty(name: String[32]):
    return name != empty(String[32])

```
Full output of error:
```
Brownie v1.18.1 - Python development framework for Ethereum

Compiling contracts...
  Vyper version: 0.3.1
Unhandled exception in 'contracts/Registry.vy':
  File "brownie/test/plugin.py", line 87, in pytest_load_initial_conftests
    active_project = project.load(project_path)
  File "brownie/project/main.py", line 768, in load
    return Project(name, project_path)
  File "brownie/project/main.py", line 188, in __init__
    self.load()
  File "brownie/project/main.py", line 245, in load
    self._compile(changed, self._compiler_config, False)
  File "brownie/project/main.py", line 100, in _compile
    build_json = compiler.compile_and_format(
  File "brownie/project/compiler/__init__.py", line 141, in compile_and_format
    output_json = compile_from_input_json(input_json, silent, allow_paths)
  File "brownie/project/compiler/__init__.py", line 252, in compile_from_input_json
    return vyper.compile_from_input_json(input_json, silent, allow_paths)
  File "brownie/project/compiler/vyper.py", line 235, in compile_from_input_json
    return vyper_json.compile_json(input_json, root_path=allow_paths)
  File "vyper/cli/vyper_json.py", line 396, in compile_json
    compiler_data, warn_data = compile_from_input_dict(input_dict, exc_handler, root_path)
  File "vyper/cli/vyper_json.py", line 328, in compile_from_input_dict
    return exc_handler(contract_path, exc, "compiler"), {}
  File "vyper/cli/vyper_json.py", line 102, in exc_handler_raises
    raise exception
  File "vyper/cli/vyper_json.py", line 319, in compile_from_input_dict
    data = vyper.compile_codes(
  File "vyper/evm/opcodes.py", line 220, in _wrapper
    return fn(*args, **kwargs)
  File "vyper/compiler/__init__.py", line 107, in compile_codes
    raise exc
  File "vyper/compiler/__init__.py", line 102, in compile_codes
    out[contract_name][output_format] = OUTPUT_FORMATS[output_format](compiler_data)
  File "vyper/compiler/output.py", line 102, in build_abi_output
    gas_estimates = build_gas_estimates(compiler_data.lll_nodes)
  File "vyper/compiler/phases.py", line 114, in lll_nodes
    self._gen_lll()
  File "vyper/compiler/phases.py", line 109, in _gen_lll
    self._lll_nodes, self._lll_runtime = generate_lll_nodes(self.global_ctx, self.no_optimize)
  File "vyper/compiler/phases.py", line 243, in generate_lll_nodes
    lll_nodes, lll_runtime = parser.parse_tree_to_lll(global_ctx)
  File "vyper/old_codegen/parser.py", line 268, in parse_tree_to_lll
    o, runtime = parse_regular_functions(
  File "vyper/old_codegen/parser.py", line 119, in parse_regular_functions
    func_lll, frame_start, frame_size = generate_lll_for_function(
  File "vyper/old_codegen/function_definitions/common.py", line 92, in generate_lll_for_function
    _, context = _run_pass(memory_allocator=None)
  File "vyper/old_codegen/function_definitions/common.py", line 89, in _run_pass
    o = generate_lll_for_external_function(code, sig, context, check_nonpayable)
  File "vyper/old_codegen/function_definitions/external_function.py", line 185, in generate_lll_for_external_function
    body = [parse_body(c, context) for c in code.body]
  File "vyper/old_codegen/function_definitions/external_function.py", line 185, in <listcomp>
    body = [parse_body(c, context) for c in code.body]
  File "vyper/old_codegen/stmt.py", line 454, in parse_body
    return parse_stmt(code, context)
  File "vyper/old_codegen/stmt.py", line 448, in parse_stmt
    return Stmt(stmt, context).lll_node
  File "vyper/old_codegen/stmt.py", line 30, in __init__
    self.lll_node = fn()
  File "vyper/old_codegen/stmt.py", line 202, in parse_Assert
    test_expr = Expr.parse_value_expr(self.stmt.test, self.context)
  File "vyper/old_codegen/expr.py", line 1078, in parse_value_expr
    return unwrap_location(cls(expr, context).lll_node)
  File "vyper/old_codegen/expr.py", line 200, in __init__
    self.lll_node = fn()
  File "vyper/old_codegen/expr.py", line 931, in parse_Compare
    [op, load_bytearray(left), load_bytearray(right)],
  File "vyper/old_codegen/expr.py", line 927, in load_bytearray
    load = load_op(side.location)
  File "vyper/old_codegen/parser_utils.py", line 448, in load_op
    raise CompilerPanic(f"unreachable {location}")  # pragma: no test
CompilerPanic: unreachable None

This is an unhandled internal compiler error. Please create an issue on Github to notify the developers.
https://github.com/vyperlang/vyper/issues/new?template=bug.md

ERROR: Unable to load project
```
Command:
```
brownie test
```

### How can it be fixed?
